abstract.para: Software RAID is a data storage virtualization technology that combines several physical disks into one or more logical units. RAID provides, depending on the RAID level, a balance among reliability, availability, performance and capacity.

topic.para: RAID is a virtual storage resource using multiple storage devices—the array, managed by a controller that links one or more computing devices to the array. The devices are presented to users as logical storage resorce.

Sofware RAID uses a disk controller software. Most RAID controllers use the SCSI protocol, because it can address a larger number of hard disks in a more effective way than the IDE protocol and is more suitable for parallel processing of commands. There are also some RAID controllers that support IDE or SATA hard disks.
